result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order Regarding Amended Bond.
Based upon the Stipulation to Amend Bond;
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED:
1. The defendant's $1,000.00 cash bond shall be amended to $505.00 cash bond, effective immediately.
2. The balance of $495.00 will be remitted to the trust account of the Eau Claire County District Attorney's Office, of which $450.00 will be subsequently disbursed to JL for restitution.

Same as Complaint.

9:31 AM cases 21CM312, 21CM579, 21CM465, 21CM678, 21CM925, 22CF47, 21CM796, 21CM797, 22CM205, 21CF1033, 21CM550, 20CM1139 called. 
Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amy M. Conner in court.  Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Amy M. Conner. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
In 22CF47: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
In all files: Defense recites the joint agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to the following counts: 
22CF47: Count 1 as charged in in the Information. 
21CF1033: Count 1 as charged in the information. 
22CM1139: Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
21CM465: Count 2 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
21CM579: Count 1 as charged in the criminal complaint. 

Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty in 22CM1139, 21CM465, and 21CM579. 
As to 22CF47 and 21CF1033: Court withholds sentencing. A 3 year DAGP is filed with and accepted by the court. 
Anything else including uncharged cases 21EC3981 and 22EC2326 are dismissed and read in. 

As to counts to which the defendant entered a plea in 22CM1139, 21CM465, 21CM579: 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
Take medications as prescribed. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide a DNA sample. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with J.L., C.T., K.N., J.D., E.S., T.K., L.W., A.N. or their residences. 
No calls to dispatch or 911 for non emergencies. 
If defendant is revoked from probation sentence credit is as follows: 
21CM579: 32 days
21CM465: 32 days 
20CM1139: 39 days 

Court modifies bond to reflect defendant can have contact with her address on Erin St. All other conditions still apply. 
Defendant's bond conditions apply during DAGP term.

(2:57 PM cases 20CM1139, 21CM312, 21CM465, 21CM550, 21CM579, 21CM678, 21CM796, 21CM797, 21CM925, 21CF1033, 22CM205, 22CF47 called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Amy M. Conner in court. Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Amy M. Conner.
Attorney Steuer advises will stipulate to the findings of the report.
State advises will stipulate to the findings of the report.
Court finds based on the findings of the report and stipulation from parties, the defendant is competent to proceed.
Attorney Steuer advises all cases will be resolving and State will need time to notify all victims of a plea hearing.
Attorney Steuer advises will be possibly requesting a bond modification in the near future.
Court advises is not going to hear bond modification at this time and is not modifying the bond without victim input.
Status Conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 1:15 pm (1/2 hour) in person.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Michael Steuer
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services (Third)
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services (Third)
Competency hearing on June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(3:58 PM cases 20CM1139, 21CF1033, 21CM312, 21CM465, 21CM550, 21CM579, 21CM678, 21CM796, 21CM797, 21CM925, 22CF47, 22CM205 called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amy M. Conner in court.  Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Amy M. Conner.
Dr. Matthew Seipel appears via video.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. State advises is ready to proceed. Attorney Steuer advises is ready to proceed.
Attorney Steuer advises doesn't object to the Court accepting the doctor's report. Attorney Steuer advises does not agree with findings of report and believes the defendant is competent to proceed.
Dr. Matthew Seipel of the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Steuer conducts cross-examination of Dr. Seipel.
State conducts re-direct of Dr. Seipel. Witness is excused.
Attorney Steuer addresses the Court and speaks on the defendant's behalf, advising the Court the defendant requests to be found competent to proceed.
Attorney Stoiber makes argument for the Court to find the defendant is not competent to proceed but likely to regain with treatment.
Attorney Steuer makes argument for the Court to find the defendant competent to proceed.
Court withholds making a finding of determination and orders another competency examination be completed.
Competency Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 3 pm.

Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Amy M. Conner in court, in custody. Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Amy M. Conner.
Attorney Steuer advises the examination has taken place virtually.
Attorney Steuer makes argument for bond modification and notes the competency hearing is already scheduled.
State makes argument for the $10,000.00 cash bond to remain in place and opposes any type of bond modification.
Court notes concerns regarding defendant's non-compliance and non-appearances and allows counsel an opportunity to respond.
Defendant's mother is present and has a discussion with the Court regarding living arrangements for the defendant.
Court orders the bond is amended to a $1,000.00 cash bond and covers cases 20CM1139, 21CM312, 21CM465, 21CM550, 21CM579, 21CM678, 21CM796, 21CM797, 21CM925, 21CF1033, 22CM205, 22CF47 with the following conditions:

11:13 AM cases 22CM205 and 22CF47 called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amy M. Conner appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Mike Steuer. Defense waives reading of the complaints in both files. Defense waives time limits for the preliminary hearing in felony file. Court orders cash bond in 21CF1033 cover both files. 
Court orders competency evaluation to be completed. Defense requests cash bond modification- denied by the Court. 
A competency hearing is scheduled for 4-28-22 at 4:00 PM in Branch 3.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on April 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

(Cases 20CM1139, 21CF1033, 21CM312, 21CM465, 21CM550, 21CM579, 21CM678, 21CM796, 21CM797, 21CM925, 22CF47, 22CM205 are called at 10:00 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Amy M. Conner appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael J Steuer for Amy M. Conner appeared by video, Attorney Robert W. Stoiber for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Warrants in 20CM1139, 21CF1033, 21CM312, 21CM465, 21CM550, 21CM579, 21CM678, 21CM796, 21CM797, 21CM925, 22CF47 are executed. Defense indicates the Defendant spoke with someone from the Wisconsin Forensic Unit and there was a misunderstanding regarding whether the examination was needed. 
Court vacates order forfeiting the $500 cash bond in 21CF1033 & 21CM678. Court orders $10,000 cash bond on each case with previously ordered conditions. 
Court orders a competency examination on all cases. 
Initial Appearance to be held on 22CF47 & 22CM205 on 3/22/2022 at 11:00 AM- Defense did not receive copies of the complaints.
J.L.L.

State indicates the Defendant has refused to be evaluated. Defense indicates he had a conversation with Defendant in which the Defendant will not comply with any competency examination and will not appear to anymore Court appearances.
